description.narrative: Over 20 million people in South Sudan, Northeast Nigeria, Somalia and Yemen will most likely be affected by famine in the next six months. To avoid even further deterioration in the humanitarian crises in the four countries in the coming months, the international community must urgently upscale and expand its emergency aid. This is why Giro555 was launched on the 6th of March with a national action in the Netherlands, to collect money desperately needed for these countries. With this money, lifesaving aid will be provided in the form of food, water, healthcare, sanitation and hygiene. These forms of aid are crucial in the prevention of and fight against famine. The Giro555 organizations work in close cooperation with international and local partners. The first and most urgent step is saving lives now. The second step is enabling people to protect themselves in a sustainable manner from hunger in the future.
People suffering from hunger/ famine in regions with IPC 3 and higher in South Sudan, Northeast Nigeria, Somalia, Yemen, Niger, Ethiopia, Kenya and Uganda

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

activity-date.narrative: On the 6th of March Giro555 launched a national action in the Netherlands, to collect money desperately needed for these four countries (South Sudan, Northeast Nigeria, Somalia and Yemen) and the surrounding countries (Ethiopia, Kenya, Niger and Uganda). From this date onwards member organisations were allowed to start with implementing programmes in these countries to support the victims of the famine and hunger.

recipient-country.narrative: In Ethiopia 2 member organisations (ICCO & Kerk in Actie and Plan Netherlands) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.

In Kenya 3 member organisations (Dutch Red Cross, Terre des Hommes and UNICEF Netherlands) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.
In Niger Oxfam Novib provides aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.

In Nigeria 5 member organisations (ICCO & Kerk in Actie, Dutch Red Cross, Oxfam Novib, Plan Netherlands and UNICEF Netherlands) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.

In Somalia 8 member organisations (CARE Netherlands, Cordaid, ICCO & Kerk in Actie, Dutch Red Cross, Oxfam Novib, Save the Children, Stichting Vluchteling and World Vision) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.

In South Sudan 8 member organisations (Cordaid, ICCO & Kerk in Actie, Dutch Red Cross, Oxfam Novib, Plan Netherlands, Save the Children, Stichting Vluchteling and Terre des Hommes provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.
In Uganda 2 member organisations (Cordaid and Dutch Red Cross) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.

In Yemen 5 member organisations (CARE Netherlands, Dutch Red Cross, Oxfam Novib, Stichting Vluchteling and UNICEF Netherlands) provide aid in states with category ICP3 or higher in sectors Water and Sanitation, Nutrition, Health and Food Security and Livelihood.
